meta.name: description
meta.content: Rockdale ISD serves K-12th grade students and is located in Rockdale, TX.

select.title: Translate this page with Google Translate

div.p:
4/17/2020 Governor Abbott announced in an executive order Friday morning that all Texas schools are closed for the remainder of the school year.
What this means for Rockdale ISD:
•distance learning (on-line and paper based) will continue through the end of the school year
•alternate plans for awards ceremonies, graduation, etc. are in the works and will be announced in the coming days
4/13/2020: Update Grading Guidelines have been posted to this page.
4/7/2020: 5TH SIX WEEKS GRADES Because of the logistics of getting work back from students, we are not issuing final grades for the 5th Six Weeks at this time. This extension will allow additional time to receive and process 5th Six Weeks assignments. Watch for updates with more information.
4/2/2020: Packets will be mailed to students who opted into paper based assignments. Click here to read more.
4/1/2020: All district offices will be closed until further notice and meal delivery service will be suspended for at least two weeks. Please call 512-430-6000, ext 1023 for meal emergencies.
3/31/2020: Due to Governor Abbott's Executive Order this afternoon, Rockdale ISD will extend distance learning until at least May 4.

section.p:
4/17/2020 Governor Abbott announced in an executive order Friday morning that all Texas schools are closed for the remainder of the school year.
What this means for Rockdale ISD:
•distance learning (on-line and paper based) will continue through the end of the school year
•alternate plans for awards ceremonies, graduation, etc. are in the works and will be announced in the coming days
4/13/2020: Update Grading Guidelines have been posted to this page.
4/7/2020: 5TH SIX WEEKS GRADES Because of the logistics of getting work back from students, we are not issuing final grades for the 5th Six Weeks at this time. This extension will allow additional time to receive and process 5th Six Weeks assignments. Watch for updates with more information.
4/2/2020: Packets will be mailed to students who opted into paper based assignments. Click here to read more.
4/1/2020: All district offices will be closed until further notice and meal delivery service will be suspended for at least two weeks. Please call 512-430-6000, ext 1023 for meal emergencies.
3/31/2020: Due to Governor Abbott's Executive Order this afternoon, Rockdale ISD will extend distance learning until at least May 4.
Enrollment for 2020-2021 PreK & Kinder enrollment is OPEN! Click here for more information.

h1.a: FFCRA Notice to employees regarding employee rights

section.p: Paid sick leave and expanded Family and Medical Leave Under the Families First Coronavirus Response Act
Visit our Digital Homeroom for access to learning activities and resources.

h1.a: Parent & Student Survey for ACE Afterschool Program

section.p:
Due to the closure of campus and the cancellation of several extracurricular activities in response to the COVID 19 pandemic, we are making changes to the spring semester’s coverage in the 2020 yearbook. We are planning to devote space to a feature titled: “QuaranTIGERS.”
Please begin taking and sending any pictures that represent your quarantine to your yearbook staff. Please email them to glwalker@rockdaleisd.net. Please include a description so that our staff can accurately caption your experience. We hope that everyone is doing well.
Tiger Fight Never Dies.

After a three week interview process, Dr. Monzingo is excited to announce that Coach Jacob Campsey will be the new Athletic Director for Rockdale ISD. "With over 70 applicants, things that stood out with Coach Campsey were his love of Rockdale, his goal to take Rockdale to the next level in all sports, and his desire to turn out not just great athletes, but great young adults."
Click here to view next year's academic calendar.

The school report card (SRC) combines accountability ratings, data from the Texas Academic Performance Reports (TAPR), and financial information to give a broad view of campus performance. Available for each campus in Texas, the SRC is intended specifically to inform parents and guardians about a school’s individual characteristics and its academic performance.
The 2018–19 school report cards are now available.
Each week, an RISD campus program or department is featured in an article in The Rockdale Reporter. You can view the current and past articles here.
